alert.note: Alert for Tulare (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 12 at 12:13AM PDT until March 12 at 3:15AM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: The National Weather Service in Hanford has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... North Central Tulare County in central California... * Until 315 AM PDT. * At 1113 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Three Rivers, Ash Mountain Sequoia Park HQ, Potwisha Campground, Buckeye Flat Campground, Giant Forest, Shadequarter Mtn, Lodgepole, Lodgepole Campground, Marble Fork Kaweah, Pear Lake Ranger Station, Redwood Meadow Patrol Cabin and Bearpaw Ranger Station. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
